lead.p: parseFloat â€“ Parses a string as a float

return.p: Returns a float representation of the string.

example.heading: parseFloat example
example.code:
console.log(parseFloat('123 String')); // 123 console.log(parseFloat('String 123')); // NaN console.log(parseFloat('12')); // 12 console.log(parseFloat(12)); // 12 console.log(parseFloat('12.42')); // 12.42
console.log(parseFloat(Infinity)); // Infinity console.log(parseFloat('Infinity')); // Infinity
